content:
Prev: Through the ring Up: Huntington Beach Kite Festival Next: Bringing the purple bear down

Explore your options for ridesharing



Hundreds of these little classical kites were strung at seven foot intervals on a line. The owner kept pulling more and more out of a cardboard box, like a magician pulling ribbons out of his mouth. Despite so many kites supplying lift, they weren't very strong, easily manageable by a single person.
Taken Sunday, February 08, 2004, 03:52:33pm.  Original image size: 3072x2048, 5.8Mb
Technical details: Canon EOS D60, 1/320s @ F8.0, ISO 100, 70-200mm/F2.8+1.4x @ 280mm (448mm equiv)
PS7 CRW 5200:-10, 0.75:14:50:70:5:25:10, Curves 0:0 - 30:15 - 60:45 - 215:225 - 255:255, Crop, USM 20:5
